page.title: 06General Description Farming
page.content:
This area is on the western fringe of the Pennines and rises from 91m to 286m. It is renowned for dairy and stock farming. The land is intensively farmed and with very small exceptions is well managed. Except for two small potato fields all the rest of the cultivated fields are meadows and pasture.
There is a large estate formerly the property of the Earl of Derby and now of Bridgewater Estates since the 1970s. Other farms are owner-occupied and all the farms employ mostly family labour.
